text: Titanite, or sphene (from the Greek sphenos (σφηνώ), meaning wedge), is a calcium titanium silicate mineral. Its chemical formula is CaTiSiO5. Iron and aluminium are sometimes found in it. Also sometimes found in it are rare earth metals including cerium and yttrium, and the actinide thorium. == References == == Other websites == * Madagascar Sphene Properties, Occurrences and Geological data Category:Titanium minerals Category:Gemstones Category:Nesosilicates
title: Titanite
